title: Wagga Wagga woman is filmed throwing a cat into the path of her dog in shocking animal cruelty
text:
A woman has been captured on video hurling a pet cat meters into the air and across her backyard.

The disturbing footage showed Charli Gowland, from Wagga Wagga in country New South Wales, throw her friend's cat into the path of a chasing dog.

Gowland told 7 News that she threw the domestic long-haired cat named Merlin because he attacked her dogs.

Her friend Jamilla Pearcy filmed and posted the video to her Instagram page, along with the title 'caption this'.

The disturbing footage showed Charli Gowland (pictured), from Wagga Wagga in country New South Wales, throw her friend's cat into the path of a chasing dog

Gowland later apologised for her 'inexcusable and wrong' actions.

Animal cruelty offences carry a maximum five years behind bars, or a $22,000 fine.

A Wagga Wagga police officer said authorities will be investigating the incident.

'I have seen the video and it's absolutely disgraceful,' she said.

'We have zero tolerance for animal cruelty in this community.

'Apart from it being really distasteful and disgusting, I don't see why anyone would see a video like that being funny.'

The RSPCA have also been notified about the incident.

The video has since gone viral, with thousand of people condemning Gowland for her cruelty.

'If the cat was supposedly attacking the dog how come it wasn’t attacking her when she was carrying it calmly in her hands?,' one person wrote.

'The person filming should be charged too,' read another comment.

'She shouldn’t be allowed to have any animals. Re home her dogs!'

authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
